graph.packing
Class GRASPPacker1

java.lang.Object
  graph.packing.GRASPPacker1
public final class GRASPPacker1
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a fast GRASP algorithm for the 1-packing problem, well-known MWIS combinatorial optimization problems. The algorithm is truly adaptive in that in every GRASP iteration, the cost of each available node is updated to reflect the fact that its "free" neighbors are only those that have not been already de-activated by other nodes that have entered the current partial solution. The actual cost of a node at any point is the node's number of free neighbors over the node's weight (the latter doesn't change). Nodes with least cost are selected first. Allows for Local-Search algorithms to kick-in after a solution has been constructed. Notice that the methods of this class access the relevant graph's nodes and data structures in an unsynchronized manner for better performance, and are therefore not thread-safe in the face of concurrent modifications to the underlying graph object.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

setAlphaFactor

set the alpha factor of the GRASP process. Should be called before the call to pack().

Parameters:

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws ParallelException
invoke as java -cp <classpath> graph.packing.GRASPPacker1 <graph_file> [numinitnodes(0)] [numiterations(1)] [do_local_search(false)] [dls_num_threads(1)] [max_allowed_time(ms)(+Inf)] [use_N2RXP_4_DLS_Faster(false)]. The graph_file contains the graph in the format specified in the comments of method utils.DataMgr.readGraphFromFile2(filename) and the numinitnodes is an optional number specifying how many (non- conflicting) nodes to choose randomly as an initial seed-set to grow from (default is zero). The solution found is written in the file "sol.out" in the current directory. It contains one line for each node included in the solution, and the line has the internal id of the node +1 (so the range of nodes is [1,...Graph.getNumNodes()].

Parameters:
args - String[] are as follows:
  • args[0] graph_file_name mandatory, the name of the file containing the graph
  • args[1] numinitnodes optional, if present describes the cardinality of an initial random population from which to attempt to construct a first partial solution. Default is 0.
  • args[2] numiterations optional, if present describes the number of major outer iterations to run. Default is 1.
  • args[3] do_local_search optional, if "true" implies a local search via the popt4jlib.LocalSearch.DLS algorithm to be performed when a solution is constructed in a major outer iteration. Default is false.
  • args[4] num_dls_threads optional, if present describes the number of threads to use in the DLS procedure if activated. Default is 1. Currently useful only if the last parameter (args[6]) is false (as is by default).
  • args[5] max_allowed_time optional, if present, sets the max. allowed time for the process to run (in milliseconds). Default is +infinity.
  • args[6] use_N2RXP_4_DLS optional, if present and true, will force the use of the IntSetN2RXP*GraphAllMovesMakerFaster move-maker in the local search (if args[3] evaluates to true). Otherwise, if local-search is asked for, the IntSetN1RXPFirstImprovingGraphAllMovesMakerMT class will be used as moves-maker in local-search. Default is false.
Throws:
ParallelException
